qas.question: When were early Armenian Christian churches built?
In which century did Armenia become Christian?
What radiating style are some Armenian churches built with?
When were Armenian churches built with center cupola cones?
When were Armenian churches built with niched buttresses?
When were the first Arab structures built?
What style of architecture so some Arab structures use?
What had formed when Hrip'sime became Christian?

plausible_answers.text: the typical cupola cone in the center

qas.question: What had become widely used in early churches?
What did some churches sometimes have in the fifth century?

context: The first Armenian churches were built <a0_0><b5_0>between the <a1_0>4th<a1_0/> and 7th century<b5_0/><a0_0/>, beginning when Armenia converted to Christianity, and ending with the Arab invasion of Armenia. The early churches were mostly simple basilicas, but some with <b9_0>side apses<b9_0/>. By the <a3_0>fifth century<a3_0/> <b8_0>the typical cupola cone in the center<b8_0/> had become widely used. By the <a4_0>seventh century<a4_0/>, centrally planned churches had been built and a more complicated niched buttress and <b6_0>radiating <a2_0>Hrip'simé<a2_0/> style<b6_0/> had formed. By the time of the Arab invasion, most of what we now know as <b7_0>classical Armenian architecture<b7_0/> had formed.
